content: crewmate… or imposter amigurumi crochet pattern © amanda perkins glamazon crochet designs difficulty easy-ish special stitches ​ finished size 12″ tall ​ hook j 6 00mm invisible decrease ​ yarn insert your hook into the front loop of the first stitch then worsted weight - two strands held together into the front loop of the next stitch pull up a loop color a - the color of your crewmate through the first 2 loops on your hook yarn over and color b - light blue or gray pull through both loops on your hook color c - black pattern notes abbreviations used mc magic_ring/magic_ring this pattern is written in american standard terms st/sts stitch/stitches increases & decreases are written to be staggered chain chain instead of having them stack directly on top of each single_crochet single_crochet other this will make them less noticeable and will also increase increase help keep your crewmate looking perfectly rounded decrease invisible decrease blo back loop only all mentions of right and left sides are always in flo front loop only reference to your crewmate s perspective if you are looking at the front of your project these will be the you will also need opposite of your right and left ​ ​ ​ yarn needle scissors this pattern uses less than one skein of each color yarn poly-fil but you may still want to buy 2 skeins of each color optional stitch markers 20mm button pins since pulling 2 strands from the same skein can be difficult instructions all rounds will be worked in a continuous spiral unless otherwise noted left leg with two strands of color a r1 6 single_crochet into a mc 6 r2 2sc into each st 12 r3 *single_crochet in first st 2 single_crochet in next st * repeat around 18 r4 *2 single_crochet in first st single_crochet in next 2 sts * repeat around 24 r5 single_crochet in blo around 24 r6-r11 single_crochet around 24 fasten_off and weave/tuck in ends right leg with two strands of color a repeat rounds 1 through 11 of the left leg do not fasten_off chain 3 single_crochet to any stitch on your left leg figure 1 ​ place a stitch marker in this single_crochet to keep it from getting lost this is your new starting place for each row of your body figure 2 ​ body continuing from right leg r1 single_crochet in next 23 sts single_crochet in front loops of chain 3 single_crochet in next 24 sts single_crochet in back loops of chain 3 54 figure 3 ​ r2 single_crochet into your marked st remove your stitch marker and in each single_crochet around 54 r3-r26 single_crochet around 54 begin stuffing your body & continue to stuff as you go r27 *single_crochet in first 3 sts decrease single_crochet in next 4 sts * repeat around 48 r28 *single_crochet in first 6 sts decrease * repeat around 42 r29 *single_crochet in first 2 sts decrease
